title: The How2Recycle label does so much right. Why are recycling rates so low? - GreenBiz
summary: The How2Recycle label is a standardized labeling system that provides clear and consistent recycling instructions to consumers. The label has grown in popularity, but recycling rates have not dramatically increased. The challenges facing recycling include a lack of data on the effectiveness of recycling programs, a fragmented recycling system, and a lack of end markets for recycled materials.

title: Philadelphia Union and Subaru Reveal Sculpture to celebrate recycling milestone - Philadelphia Union
summary: Subaru of America, Inc. and the Philadelphia Union have revealed a unique “zero landfill” sculpture at Subaru Park in Chester, PA to commemorate its status as the first zero landfill stadium in Major League Soccer. Since achieving the milestone in 2021, Subaru and the Union have diverted more than one million pounds of waste from landfills. Subaru has been dedicated to helping other businesses and organizations achieve the same zero waste status that the Subaru of Indiana Automotive manufacturing plant achieved in 2004 and has freely shared knowledge with over 900 companies worldwide to help make the world a better place.

title: SK Chemicals to supply Estée Lauder with eco-friendly packaging materials - Premium beauty
summary: The Estée Lauder Companies has partnered with SK Chemicals to use advanced recycling to make packaging for all of their beauty brands out of recycled and recyclable materials. SK Chemicals will supply The Estée Lauder Companies with resins incorporating advanced recycled materials such as Ecotria CR and Skypet CR, or that can be incorporated into a recycle stream, such as Ecozen Claro. The Estée Lauder Companies and SK Chemicals will gradually increase the amount of recycled materials in their products and replace other non-recyclable materials, with designs that incorporate recyclable or recycled materials.
green_innovation: TRUE, because it will reduce the environmental impacts of packaging by using recycled and recyclable materials.

green_product: TRUE, because it will be made with recycled and recyclable materials.
green_process: TRUE, because the advanced recycling process chemically decomposes waste plastic into monomers, which can then be used to make new plastic products.

title: Circularity comes to wiring accessories in new Nordic launch | ABB - ABB
summary: ABB's new wiring collection, SAGA™, is made from bio-circular, recyclable materials and manufactured primarily in net-zero operations. title: Young people across Leeds urged to get involved with the big recycling hunt, part of Recycle Week 2023 - Leeds City Council News
summary: Leeds City Council and Recycle Now are launching a fun mission for primary school children with the arrival of the big recycling hunt. The big recycling hunt aims to engage children and families in the quest to find 'lost recyclables' that too often find their way into the rubbish bin. By focusing on commonly missed items such as empty aerosols, plastic cleaning product bottles, plastic toiletry bottles, plastic pots and tubs, and food tins, Recycle Now wants to foster a deeper understanding of recycling in the younger generation.
